intro: Cyrtandra nibongensis, commonly known as the Bornean cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland and hill forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Cyrtandra nibongensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
